t: Proverbs 22
A*pn good name is to be chosen rather than great riches, and*ld favor is better than silver or gold.
The*ln rich and the poor meet together; the*ld Lord*s is the Maker of them all.
The*ln prudent sees danger and hides himself, but*ld the simple go on and suffer for it.
The*ln reward for humility and fear of the Lord*s is*ld riches and honor and life.
Thorns*ln and snares are in the way of the crooked; whoever*ld guards his soul will keep far from them.
Train*ln up a child in the way he should go; even*ld when he is old he will not depart from it.
The*ln rich rules over the poor, and*ld the borrower is the slave of the lender.
Whoever*ln sows injustice will reap calamity, and*ld the rod of his fury will fail.
Whoever*ln has a bountiful eye will be blessed, for*ld he shares his bread with the poor.
Drive*ln out a scoffer, and strife will go out, and*ld quarreling and abuse will cease.
He*ln who loves purity of heart, and*ld whose speech is gracious, will have the king as his friend.
The*ln eyes of the Lord*s keep watch over knowledge, but*ld he overthrows the words of the traitor.
The*ln sluggard says, “There is a lion outside! I*ld shall be killed in the streets!”
The*ln mouth of forbidden women is a deep pit; he*ld with whom the Lord*s is angry will fall into it.
Folly*ln is bound up in the heart of a child, but*ld the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
Whoever*ln oppresses the poor to increase his own wealth, or*ld gives to the rich, will only come to poverty.
Words of the Wise
Incline*pn your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and*ld apply your heart to my knowledge,
for*ln it will be pleasant if you keep them within you, if*ld all of them are ready on your lips.
That*ln your trust may be in the Lord,*s I*ld have made them known to you today, even to you.
Have*ln I not written for you thirty sayings of*ld counsel and knowledge,
to*ln make you know what is right and true, that*ld you may give a true answer to those who sent you?
Do*pn not rob the poor, because he is poor, or*ld crush the afflicted at the gate,
for*ln the Lord*s will plead their cause and*ld rob of life those who rob them.
Make*ln no friendship with a man given to anger, nor*ld go with a wrathful man,
lest*ln you learn his ways and*ld entangle yourself in a snare.
Be*ln not one of those who give pledges, who*ld put up security for debts.
If*ln you have nothing with which to pay, why*ld should your bed be taken from under you?
Do*ln not move the ancient landmark that*ld your fathers have set.
Do*ln you see a man skillful in his work? He*ld will stand before kings; he*ld will not stand before obscure men.
